intro: Tillandsia standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican air plant, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is an epiphytic plant that grows on other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant has a rosette-shaped structure with narrow, strap-like leaves that can store water. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue and are borne in a terminal inflorescence. Tillandsia standleyi is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments.
